text.__SUMMARY__: Blanford's fruit bat (Sphaerias blanfordi)  is a mountain species of megabat. The only recording of it was from the Doi Suthep-Pui National Park in Chiengmai, Thailand. According to Lekagul and McNeely (1977), the species is confined to the Thai-Burmese border, Uttar Pradesh in India and eastern Nepal.
text.Taxonomy:
Blanford's fruit bat was described as a new species in 1891 by English zoologist Oldfield Thomas, who put it in the genus Cynopterus (C. blanfordi). The eponym for its specific epithet "blanfordi" is English naturalist William Thomas Blanford.
